issue.title: [BUG] Wrong category size of Bar with min ,max options.

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body:
Hi! thank you for provide excellent chart library.
I would like to report some issue.

## Current Behavior
With `min` (or `max`) option, Category size probably calculated from the total number of labels, not the number of labels displayed.
Then, the size of bar will be smaller and shift ,even though `categoryPercentage` and `barPercentage` is 1.
(also Issues #3506 plugin added)

![report-chartjs-wrongcategorysize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22541770/20247463/bb587cc6-aa07-11e6-94ec-49a3cbceda53.png)


## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)

[jsfiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/d29yoL8u/5/)

1. Chart type is "bar"
1. Set min or max, both also.
1. When executed, the bar position will be smaller and shift left. (You can see easily when `categoryPercentage` and `barPercentage` is 1 )
1. line is work.

## Environment
Chart.js version : 2.4.0
Browser name and version : Microsoft Edge 38.14393.0.0
Link to my project : https://jsfiddle.net/d29yoL8u/5
                    Added Issues #3506 duplicate of #3491 and #2870

issue.title: Fix miscalculation of Bar width.

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body:
Fixed a mistake in calculating the width of the bar when setting the `min` `max` option.
The getRuler function performs complicated calculations, but as a result of checking it can be made more simple.

Also fixed the issue that `barPercentage` is disabled when stacked scale.

Resolves #3589


## Testing
I updated the unit test.
Please delete it if it is unnecessary.

## After

## When added plugin

issue.title: Implement clipping

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body:
I tried implementing clipping chart area.
I would be pleased if you like it.

Resolves #3506, #3491, #2873

## Bar and Line chart.
### Before
![non clip bar line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22541770/20744270/f40c6148-b715-11e6-85dc-8e3ba285b571.png)

https://jsfiddle.net/KoyoSE/n7ben0fx/
### After
![clip bar line](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22541770/20744275/fa63a8bc-b715-11e6-8439-3965ad51074a.png)

https://jsfiddle.net/KoyoSE/98x7ny4b/
(Note: jsfeddle takes time to execute.This is because I put the built chart.js in the html area.)
Line chart: The point fades out when going out.


## Radar and Scatter chart.
### Before
![non clip radar scatter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22541770/20744279/03825d12-b716-11e6-9b15-af68accc23ea.png)

https://jsfiddle.net/KoyoSE/fwt4bxcc/
 (Do Radar chart have to consider the drawing of the points below min?)
### After
![clip radar scatter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22541770/20744286/0a75d284-b716-11e6-8238-bbd7b7ae3905.png)

https://jsfiddle.net/KoyoSE/7v3ehcqt/
(Note: jsfeddle takes time to execute.This is because I put the built chart.js in the html area.)
Radar chart: It works the same before. Clipping is not done.
The Radar chart, the following error is displayed on the console.
'Unable to get property 'xAxes' of undefined or null reference'
This is solved by removing #3620.

## Other
1. It may be better to display the tool tip position in the chart area.
1. Drawing Bezier curve is slightly strange. Especially outside the chart area.


chart.js version v2.4.0

issue.title: [BUG] Bar Chart zero value when minimum ticks is 1

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body:
## Expected Behavior
If the minimum ticks on the y scale is 1 and one of the data points has a value of 0, it should not be displayed. This possibly happens any time a value below minimum is provided, but I have not tested this.

## Current Behavior
A small portion of the bar is displayed below the x-axis.

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
Here is a fiddle:
https://jsfiddle.net/rp5syxu1/1/
1. Set min ticks to be a number (in this case 1) and max to a number higher than min.
2. Provide data that is below the min (in this case 0)

## Context
This hasn't really affected me as I can just substitute 0 with null and it won't display, but I just came across it and figured I should report it.

## Environment
<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->
* Chart.js version: 2.4.0
* Browser name and version: Chrome latest
* Link to your project: https://jsfiddle.net/rp5syxu1/1/
